section.name: Hibernate Cartridge Namespace Properties
section.p: In addition to the applicable UML Metafacade namespace properties which may also be used, this page describes namespace properties specific to this cartridge only.

tr.td: languageMappingsUri
URI specifying the specific mappings from model types to language types. (i.e. file:${basedir}/JavaMappings.xml)
Yes
hibernateTypeMappingsUri

URI specifying the specific mappings from model types to hibernate types. (i.e. file:${basedir}/HibernateTypeMappings.xml). This is not necessary but useful for defining hibernate user types (when hibernate doesn't support a specific type in the manner needed for your application).
No
customTypesPackage
The package to which hibernate custom types contained within the cartridge should be output.
No, default is org.andromda.persistence.hibernate
entities
The directory to which hibernate entities are generated.
Yes (unless ignore is specified for this property)
entity-impls
The location to which hibernate entity implementation files are generated.
Yes (unless ignore is specified for this property)
session-beans
The directory to which Session Bean files are generated.
Yes (unless ignore is specified for this property)
session-impls
The directory to which Session Bean implementation files are generated.
Yes (unless ignore is specified for this property)
defaultIdentifierType

The type to give default identifiers. This setting is overridden from
UML Metafacade defaultIdentifierType in order to make it consistent with idGeneratorClass setting. If the idGeneratorClass setting is changed then the defaultIdentifier setting should be consistent with the change.
No, default is datatype.String.
ejbJndiNamePrefix
The prefix to give to the Session EJB JNDI names (this allows the same Session EJB to be deployed multiple times in the same container)
No, default is no prefix.
idGeneratorClass
The class to use for Hibernate ID generation.
No, default is uuid.hex
tableNamePrefix
The string to prepend to each table name.
No, default is the empty string
versionProperty

The name of the property/attribute to automatically add to entities for versioning purposes. If this value is not specified or it contains only whitespace characters it will be ignored and the property will not be generated.
No, default is the empty string
